item.title: Randy McCallahan (not verified): Comment 1
item.dcterms:creator: Randy McCallahan (not verified)
item.description:
@TOR developers

Please wait for publishing of security-related bug information until BSD users are able to upgrade their system. Keep in mind that the BSD ports collection sometimes will be updated with a delay. This means that the time a tor server operator decides to update his system has to be added to the delayed time the new tor version is really available in the BSD ports collection tree.

Tnx
RMcC

item.title: phobos: Comment 2
item.dcterms:creator: phobos
item.description: Yes, we're waiting to disclose the details in order to give users and node operators time to upgrade.

item.title: arma: Comment 3
item.dcterms:creator: arma
item.description:
Can you give us some hint about when you think BSD users will be in better shape? We're currently planning to wait a few weeks, but we weren't planning to wait a few months. Is that too short?

(I need to go bug the Ubuntu people to stop shipping Tor 0.1.2.x and move
to 0.2.0.x, so that's another stumbling block that's holdiing us up.)

item.title: PETER (not verified): Comment 4
item.dcterms:creator: PETER (not verified)
item.description: Warning message in TBB Controler used oboselete addr-mappings/GETINFO Key; use-address-mappings/instead. Please fix it.

item.title: phobos: Comment 5
item.dcterms:creator: phobos
item.description: This is a problem with Vidalia. It will be fixed in the next release of Vidalia.

item.title: PETER (not verified): Comment 7
item.dcterms:creator: PETER (not verified)
item.description: when will be the next release?After releasing it willl be posted here. Please answer.

item.title: phobos: Comment 8
item.dcterms:creator: phobos
item.description: Vidalia is still very much under active development. I don't know the release schedule at this time. For now, just ignore that message.

item.title: PETER (not verified): Comment 9
item.dcterms:creator: PETER (not verified)
item.description: k phobos thanx 4 answering my questions. Looking forward 2 c more.

item.title: Randy McCallahan (not verified): Comment 10
item.dcterms:creator: Randy McCallahan (not verified)
item.description:
Since 29. January the FreeBSD ports of Tor are up to date.

http://www.freshports.org/security/tor-devel/
http://www.freshports.org/security/tor

Now it's up to the tor operator to update his system.

item.title: arma: Comment 11
item.dcterms:creator: arma
item.description:
Great to hear.

But just to keep things exciting, we put out a new stable and development
release today (0.2.0.34 / 0.2.1.12-alpha), with more security fixes.

Hopefully these new fixes will last us for a while yet.
